abstract: Shortly after the Treasury Department allowed 10 big banks to repay federal bailout money, the chief of one of those firms, Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase, sent a memo to employees about the move. Read it on DealBook.
snippet: Shortly after the Treasury Department allowed 10 big banks to repay federal bailout money, the chief of one of those firms, Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase, sent a memo to employees about the move. Read it on DealBook.
lead_paragraph: Barely a week ago, Jamie Dimon, the head of JPMorgan Chase, joked about writing a “Dear Timmy” letter to the Treasury secretary announcing his bank’s departure from the government bailout.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Dimon on Repaying TARP Money
